claim: Two students share the president role in the Student Club this term.
extra_info: 'President' is a position of Student Club
reasoning: The claim states two students share the President role, but querying the member table for position = 'President' returns only one member (Sacha Harrison). Therefore the claim is contradicted by the data.

content.text: I'll verify this claim by examining the database schema and querying for presidents.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
attendance  event       income      member    
budget      expense     major       zip_code

tool_use_result.stdout:
attendance  event       income      member    
budget      expense     major       zip_code

content.content:
CREATE TABLE event
(
    event_id   TEXT
        constraint event_pk
            primary key,
    event_name TEXT,
    event_date TEXT,
    type       TEXT,
    notes      TEXT,
    location   TEXT,
    status     TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE major
(
    major_id   TEXT
        constraint major_pk
            primary key,
    major_name TEXT,
    department TEXT,
    college    TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE zip_code
(
    zip_code    INTEGER
        constraint zip_code_pk
            primary key,
    type        TEXT,
    city        TEXT,
    county      TEXT,
    state       TEXT,
    short_state TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "attendance"
(
    link_to_event  TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    primary key (link_to_event, link_to_member),
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,
    link_to_event TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(
    expense_id          TEXT
            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,
    expense_date        TEXT,
    cost                REAL,
    approved            TEXT,
    link_to_member      TEXT,
    link_to_budget      TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_budget) references budget(budget_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "income"
(
    income_id      TEXT
        constraint income_pk
            primary key,
    date_received  TEXT,
    amount         INTEGER,
    source         TEXT,
    notes          TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "member"
(
    member_id     TEXT
        constraint member_pk
            primary key,
    first_name    TEXT,
    last_name     TEXT,
    email         TEXT,
    position      TEXT,
    t_shirt_size  TEXT,
    phone         TEXT,
    zip           INTEGER,
    link_to_major TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_major) references major(major_id),
    foreign key (zip) references zip_code(zip_code)
);

CREATE TABLE event
(
    event_id   TEXT
        constraint event_pk
            primary key,
    event_name TEXT,
    event_date TEXT,
    type       TEXT,
    notes      TEXT,
    location   TEXT,
    status     TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE major
(
    major_id   TEXT
        constraint major_pk
            primary key,
    major_name TEXT,
    department TEXT,
    college    TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE zip_code
(
    zip_code    INTEGER
        constraint zip_code_pk
            primary key,
    type        TEXT,
    city        TEXT,
    county      TEXT,
    state       TEXT,
    short_state TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "attendance"
(
    link_to_event  TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    primary key (link_to_event, link_to_member),
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,
    link_to_event TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(
    expense_id          TEXT
            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,
    expense_date        TEXT,
    cost                REAL,
    approved            TEXT,
    link_to_member      TEXT,
    link_to_budget      TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_budget) references budget(budget_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "income"
(
    income_id      TEXT
        constraint income_pk
            primary key,
    date_received  TEXT,
    amount         INTEGER,
    source         TEXT,
    notes          TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "member"
(
    member_id     TEXT
        constraint member_pk
            primary key,
    first_name    TEXT,
    last_name     TEXT,
    email         TEXT,
    position      TEXT,
    t_shirt_size  TEXT,
    phone         TEXT,
    zip           INTEGER,
    link_to_major TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_major) references major(major_id),
    foreign key (zip) references zip_code(zip_code)
);

content.text: Now let me query for members with the "President" position:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "SELECT member_id, first_name, last_name, position FROM member WHERE position = 'President';"
input.description: Find all members with President position

content.text:
Only **one** student holds the President position, not two.

The claim states "Two students share the president role," but the data shows only one member (Sacha Harrison) has the President position.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "The claim states two students share the President role, but querying the member table for position = 'President' returns only one member (Sacha Harrison). Therefore the claim is contradicted by the data."}
```
